data.title: Election Watch
data.text:
At stake in this election:

Seats in the Grand and General Council: 60

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: Captain Regent Fabio BERARDI and Captain Regent Luigi LONFERNINI

Head of Government: Secretary of State for Foreign and Political Affairs Gabriele GATTI

Parliament: The Grand and General Council consist of 60 members

Description of electoral system:

San Marino has a unicameral system consisting of the Grand and General Council. Members are elected by popular vote to serve five-year terms.

The Grand and General Council elect the Captain Regents for six-month terms.

Results of the electoral race:

Party: San Marino Christian Democratic Party (PDCS)

Leader: Pier Marino MENICUCCI

Seats won in this election: 25

Seats won in the last election: 25

San Marino Socialist Party (PSS)

Leaders: Augusto CASALI

Seats won in this election: 15

Seats won in last election: 14

Party: Democratic Party (PPDS)

Leader: Claudio FELICI

Seats won in this election: 12

Seats won in last election: 11

Party: San Marino Popular Democratic Party (APDS)

Leader: Mario VENTURINI

Seats won in this election: 5

Seats won in the last election: 6

Party: Communist Refoundation (RC)

Leader: Giuseppe AMICI

Seats won in this election: 2

Seats won in the last election: 2

When was the last legislative election? Number of seats decided in last election?

Parliamentary elections to the Grand and General Council last held: May 31, 1998

Seats decided in the last election: 60

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 26,937 (July 2000)

Number of registered voters: 30,688

SOURCE: INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION FOR ELECTION SYSTEMS (IFES)
